properties.name: Brazil, Indiana
properties.description: Posted by DwestonBrazil is perhaps the least obscure city on my around the world map - it even has a website! Most any Hoosier could tell you vaguely where it is located. Anyone in the southern half of the state is decidedly unimpressed when you announce that you just returned from a trip to Brazil. The gig is up - they know you didn\'t cross state boundaries, let alone the intercontinental boundaries. Forest Park in Brazil houses 2 small restored cabins built in 1856 as well as a large elaborate fountain (picture coming soon). The fountain was a gift from the country of Brazil and erected in 1955 as a copy of the 1745 Brazilian original. 1990 population = 7,640. Settled before 1834 and laid out on July 4, 1844. Distance between Brazil, In and Rio de Janeiro, Brazil (as the crow flies) = 5,138 miles.

properties.name: Childhood home
properties.description: Posted by Dweston52800 Elm Dr, La Pine, OR 97739This is the IEA to 528 Elm Dr., Plainfield, IN. I lived at the real deal from age 2 until I went off to college (Purdue University). Shortly after we moved, a neighbor came to greet us and gave my brother and me chicken pox. We had a fire in the garage at some point, with no major damage. We were constantly battling water leaks, it seems, especially as the home got older. I wonder if the Oregon version has the same problems.

properties.name: Cuba, Indiana
properties.description: Posted by DwestonThis is one of three, count them THREE, Cubas in Indiana. This particular Cuba is in Owen County, and is a bit of a ghost town. Actually, it probably never had much of a night life. Cuba was founded in 1851 and originally called Santa Fe. Later the same year it had its own post office under the Cuba name. In 1895, Cuba busted into the triple digits, with a population of 118. Sadly, by the look of things, those 118 took off or failed to procreate as I saw no inhabitants or houses at all. The post office closed in 1909. In any case, today there\'s an old (though still active) Baptist Church, a cemetary, and some kind of shooting range compound (don\'t know if still active - didn\'t stick around to find out). The distance between Cuba, Owen County, IN and Havana, Cuba, as the crow flies, is 1,149 miles.

properties.name: Poland, Indiana
properties.description: Posted by Dweston8460 East State Road 42, Poland, IN, 47868Poland is a very advanced civilization. They have a gas station, their own post office, a chapel (circa 1850), a cemetery, and a bat sanctuary. Local Poles informed me that the old Poland Hardware building (circa early 1900s) houses a large colony of a protected bat species. None of them could tell me what kind of bats they were, but one young man managed an excellent bat imitation. Aside from bat talk, citizens of Poland seemed preoccupied with the activities of area police officers. When I walked up to Hillman\'s Market, a small gas station/food shack, there was a sheriff and various cops on the porch talking to a group of teens. Something about someone reporting a woman driving around waving a shotgun. I later talked to an anonymous source who told me that the feuding Poles stir up a lot of trouble in Clay County. Travelers beware. Back in time: Poland was founded in 1841 and had a population of 178 in 1895. One of the locals I talked to estimated the current population at 250, though the state counts way more (6,500), including all the areas served by the Poland (Polish?) post office. The distance between Poland, IN and Warsaw, Poland, as the crow flies, is 4,776 miles.
